seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is an Indian SaaS-based digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software.

pricing_models.type: Flat fee plus user license fees
pricing_models.description: Whatfix pricing is based on two components: a flat per-application fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.duration: Annual billing, term length varies based on contract

pricing_models.description: Whatfix offers a free plan with 30 credits.
Whatfix offers a basic plan at $39 per month.

buyer_research.name: Cisco
buyer_research.description: Cisco is an American multinational digital communications technology conglomerate corporation headquartered in San Jose, California.

competitors.name: WalkMe
cons: Lacking robust cross-platform or multi-app adoption capabilities
differentiators: Advanced features such as multi-format content publishing, analytics, automation, and support for non-Oracle apps

competitors.name: Pendo
differentiators: Superior click tracking capabilities with a score of 9.7 compared to Pendo's 8.3

pains: Current methods of user onboarding and training may be time-consuming or ineffective
Difficulty in driving user adoption and maximizing technology investments
Challenges in achieving desired business outcomes
Inefficient use of resources due to poor user adoption
Difficulty in measuring the effectiveness of training and onboarding programs
objections: Whatfix may not be able to integrate with our existing systems and applications
The cost of implementing and maintaining Whatfix may be prohibitive
We may not have the necessary resources or expertise to fully utilize Whatfix
Whatfix may not provide the level of customization and flexibility we need
We are already using a digital adoption platform and are not looking to switch
We are not convinced that Whatfix can provide a significant return on investment
We have concerns about the security and integrity of our data with Whatfix
Whatfix may not be able to support our specific use cases and requirements

messages.content: Hi, thanks for taking the time to speak with me today. I'm excited to learn more about Cisco's goals and challenges. Can you start by telling me a bit about your role and what you're hoping to achieve in the next quarter?

Hi, I'm John, the Senior Director of IT Operations. I oversee our technology investments and user adoption initiatives. We're looking to accelerate our digital transformation and drive user adoption of our software applications.
That's great. Accelerating digital transformation and driving user adoption are key goals for many of our customers. What specific challenges are you facing in achieving these goals?

One of the main challenges is that our current methods of user onboarding and training are time-consuming and ineffective. We're struggling to get our employees to adopt new software applications, and it's impacting our ability to maximize our technology investments.

I understand. Ineffective user onboarding and training can be a significant barrier to achieving business outcomes. Have you considered using a digital adoption platform to support your user onboarding and training initiatives?
We've looked at a few options, but we're not sure if they can integrate with our existing systems and applications. We also have concerns about the cost of implementation and maintenance.

I completely understand. Integration and cost are critical considerations when evaluating a digital adoption platform. Whatfix offers a flat fee plus user license fees pricing model, and we have a proven track record of integrating with a wide range of systems and applications. We'd be happy to provide a customized demo to show you how Whatfix can support your specific use cases and requirements.
That sounds interesting. We'd like to learn more about how Whatfix can support our use cases. Can you tell me more about your solution and how it's helped other customers in the technology industry?

Whatfix offers a comprehensive digital adoption platform that provides in-app guidance, training, and performance support for web applications and software. We've worked with many technology companies, including [similar companies], to accelerate their digital transformation and drive user adoption. Our solution is designed to be flexible and customizable to meet the specific needs of our customers.
That sounds like it could be a good fit for us. What's the typical implementation timeline for Whatfix, and what kind of support do you offer during the implementation process?

Our implementation timeline typically ranges from a few weeks to a few months, depending on the complexity of the project. We offer a comprehensive implementation program that includes dedicated support from our customer success team, as well as access to our knowledge base and training resources.
Okay, that sounds reasonable. What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix?

Our customers have seen significant ROI from implementing Whatfix, including increased user adoption, improved employee productivity, and reduced support requests. We've seen an average ROI of [X]% within the first [X] months of implementation.
That's impressive. We'd like to move forward with the next steps. What's the process for getting started with Whatfix?

I'm excited to move forward. The next step would be to schedule a customized demo to show you how Whatfix can support your specific use cases and requirements. After that, we can discuss pricing and implementation details. Would that work for you?
Yes, that works for us. Let's schedule the demo for next week.
Sounds great. I'll send over a calendar invite for next week. Thank you for your time today, and I look forward to speaking with you again soon.

pain_points: struggling to get employees to adopt new software applications
impact on ability to maximize technology investments
objections: concerns about the cost of implementation and maintenance
uncertainty about integration with existing systems and applications
time_lines: implementation timeline ranging from a few weeks to a few months
decision_committee: John, the Senior Director of IT Operations

What specific challenges are you facing in achieving these goals?
Have you considered using a digital adoption platform to support your user onboarding and training initiatives?

objection_resolution_pairs.resolution: Whatfix offers a flat fee plus user license fees pricing model, and we have a proven track record of integrating with a wide range of systems and applications.

insights: Cisco is struggling to get employees to adopt new software applications, which is impacting their ability to maximize technology investments.
Whatfix's digital adoption platform can support Cisco's user onboarding and training initiatives.
Whatfix has a proven track record of integrating with a wide range of systems and applications.
improvements: The seller could have asked more questions to understand Cisco's current methods of user onboarding and training.
The seller could have provided more details about Whatfix's implementation process and timeline.
